name: False Dilemma
description: There are only two possibilities, either positive or negative.

name: False Premise
description: Faulty worldview, false premise, non-existent, irrational.

name: False Analogy
description: If A, and B both have some feature in common, then the other features of A that B also has.

name: Fallacy of Composition
description: E.g., tyres are made of rubber, therefore the car is also made of rubber

name: False Cause
description: Things happen sequentially: there is a correlation, but not cause and effect.

name: Improper Transposition
description: If A then B, then B then A.

name: Improper Distribution or Addition
description: E.g., one minute late for class, sixty people in the class, one hour wasted on everyone.

name: Contextomy
description: Taking something out of context, only in the case of quoting a ‘person’, an advert, something published, or a famous saying, as opposed to equivocation, which must be a quotation of something.

name: Inverse Error
description: If A then B, then not A then not B. Denying the antecedent.
